choices.E: Connect the new FI-A to FI-B using the Layer1/Layer 2 cables only. Sync the configuration when prompted. Connect the management interface when the configuration is synced.
choices.A: Connect the new FI-A to the management network and the Layer 1/Layer 2 links to the existing FI-B. Use the Full State Backup file to restore the configuration when prompted at the console.
choices.B: Connect the new FI-A to the management network and the Layer 1/Layer 2 links to the existing FI-B. Let the system sync with FI-B when prompted at the console.
choices.D: Connect the new FI-A to the management network only. Use the Full State Backup file to restore the configuration through Cisco UCS Manager GUI. Connect the Layer 1/Layer 2 cables.
choices.C: Connect the FI-A to the management network and the Layer 1/Layer 2 links to the existing FI-B. Use the All Configuration backup file to restore the configuration through Cisco UCS Manager GUI.

questions.question_text: An administrator is replacing a fabric interconnect. The failed fabric interconnect was FI-A and was master at the time of failure. Which process brings the replacement fabric interconnect into the cluster?

discussion.content: Still toggling between B und E. Usually you start with updating firmware in standalone mode and therefore you need the mgmt port, and then you need to erase the config. The second FI will not switch back automatically, so whats the issue with cabling the mgmt port ?

Desired minimum transmit interval—The interval at which this device wants to send BFD hello messages.
Required minimum receive interval—The minimum interval at which this device can accept BFD hello messages from another BFD device.
Detect multiplier—The number of missing BFD hello messages from another BFD device before this local device detects a fault in the forwarding path.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/5_x/nx-os/interfaces/configuration/guide/if_cli/if_bfd.html
Desired - device wants to send, Required - device accepts, Multiplier - num of missing BFD hellos

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the term about BFD session parameters from the left onto the correct definition on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
Which three options can be used to add a device as a member to a zone? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Multicast routes are used to directly forward traffic without making RPF checks.
choices.B: IPv6 static multicast routes are supported.
choices.C: You can define RPF routes for multicast when you want multicast data to diverge from the unicast traffic path.
choices.E: RPF routes for multicast can be redistributed.
choices.D: You can define RPF routes for multicast on border routers to enable reverse path forwarding to an external network.

discussion.content: D. You can define RPF routes for multicast on border routers to enable reverse path forwarding to an external network.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about multicast routing are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I think BCE are correct. Since UCSM V1.4 applicance ports can be defined and connected in EHM.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which three steps must be taken to add NFS storage to the Cisco UCS domain? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Create an appliance VLAN on fabric A and fabric B.
choices.C: Configure Eth1/17 as an appliance port.
choices.F: Configure Eth1/17 as a unified storage port. ABC
choices.D: Configure a QoS policy for NFS storage.
choices.A: Configure fabric interconnect A and B to Ethernet switching mode.
choices.B: Create a LAN cloud VLAN on fabric A and fabric B.
